title: Box
surface: While tidying up my belongings, I found a box containing a tattered photo, and tears streamed down my face.
bottom: When I was little, I was mischievous and accidentally set fire to my room with a match. I was so scared that I ran away without telling my parents, who were at home, taking only a family photo that they had kept on me in case I got lost. My family died in that fire, and I was forced to leave my hometown. For many years, I have lived in regret. Years later, I saw this photo again. The house in the photo was my former home, with my parents standing on either side, smiling and holding my hands. This stirred up years of unresolved guilt and remorse deep within me, causing tears to stream down my face.
tips: I once caused a fire
The fire led to the death of my family
I fled the fire scene out of fear
The only item I took was a family photo
The photo evoked memories of past guilt and remorse

title: Fake Medicine
surface: A man suffered from a severe illness that could only be alleviated by a special drug, which required long-term use to be effective. He specifically asked his family to buy the drug from abroad. When he saw the drug, he knew he was doomed.
bottom: The man was a manufacturer of counterfeit drugs. He specifically counterfeited expensive special drugs, producing ineffective but much cheaper fake medicines, which earned him a lot of money. However, he didn't expect bad money to drive out good; the market was gradually dominated by fake drugs. So, even when he bought this special drug from abroad, it was still the fake medicine he himself had produced. Thus, he knew he was beyond saving.
tips: The man was in the pharmaceutical industry
The man manufactured counterfeit versions of a special drug
The counterfeit drug produced by the man was ineffective
The market was flooded with counterfeit drugs
The 'special drug' the man bought was the fake medicine he himself produced

title: Hero
surface: He was the hero who saved the nation. My hero is no longer a hero. I betrayed my hero, but my hero is still a hero.
bottom: When the nation was in crisis, he appeared, repelling the enemy with great power and excellent leadership, saving me and the country. He was my hero. Once the birds are gone, the good bow is put away; his power aroused the dissatisfaction of the powerful, and he was slandered as a traitor. To protect him, I accepted the higher-ups' order to hunt him down, ambushing him and severely wounding him, causing him to fall into an abyss full of monsters. But I knew he wouldn't die; the harsh environment would only make him stronger. I returned to that country, corrupted by the powerful, meticulously planned, and eventually assassinated the king to become monarch. I announced a policy of survival of the fittest, where only the strong could survive. During my reign, rivers of blood flowed, and I was called a tyrant. Finally, he returned, more powerful than ever! I fought him to my heart's content, happily watching him plunge his sword into my chest. He was even stronger than I imagined. I smiled, "The tyrant is dead; your name as hero will resound throughout the world."
tips: I 'betrayed' the hero to protect him
I pushed the hero into danger to make him stronger
I became a tyrant to purge corrupt power and pave the way for the hero's return
My 'betrayal' was a ruse, ultimately aimed at solidifying the 'hero's' reputation
My sacrifice was part of the plan, using my death to consolidate the hero's position

title: Destiny
surface: Every night, the deity would come into my dreams, asking me to wear that crown. Many wanted to wear that crown, but I didn't. Giant waves rose on the calm sea, and amidst lightning and thunder, I put on the blood-soaked crown. The cowardly me shed tears.
bottom: Our kingdom was protected by a deity, and each king was chosen by the deity. Children across the country became king candidates and participated in training. Everyone hoped to wear that crown, symbolizing power, and become the deity's chosen one, except for me. However, if this crown was worn by someone not chosen by the deity, the wearer would die. The deity appeared in my dreams, enticing and coercing me to wear that crown. I knew I was chosen, but I didn't want to be king, to endure boundless loneliness and responsibility. My evasion angered the deity, causing strong winds and thunderstorms in our kingdom. Others frantically put on the crown hoping to appease the deity's wrath, only to die one by one. The cowardly me finally recognized reality and accepted my destiny to wear the crown when my dear friend died in front of me.
tips: The crown is a symbol of kingship, and the king is chosen by a deity
I am the one chosen by the deity, but I do not want to be king
The crown can only be worn by the chosen one, otherwise it leads to death
My refusal caused the deity to unleash disaster
I finally accepted my destiny to become king in the face of my friend's death

title: Sister Drum
surface: "Sister..." The visitor was a bloody mess. I knew I couldn't escape.
bottom: The village had a custom of making human skin drums, requiring human skin to be flayed alive and made into sacrificial drums. This year, I was chosen. That night, locked in the temple, I was terrified. I didn't want to die; I wanted to live. My twin sister came to visit me, so I deceived her, letting her take my place as the sacrifice, and I escaped from the village with its evil custom. Due to extreme resentment, my flayed sister turned into a vengeful ghost! Bloody and without her skin, she found me and called me "Sister." I knew I couldn't escape...
tips: The story's background includes a custom of human sacrifice (human skin drums)
I deceived my twin sister, making her take my place as the sacrifice
The sister, after being flayed, transformed into a vengeful ghost seeking revenge
"Bloody mess" refers to the sister's state after being flayed
I realized I couldn't escape my sister's revenge

title: Saving All Beings
surface: One sword, two swords, three swords... my vision was blurred, but I knew I wouldn't die. Perhaps... this was also a way to save all beings.
bottom: As an immortal undergoing trials in the mortal realm, I needed to govern the nation as a mortal to inherit my sect's ultimate teachings. Under my rule, the people lived in peace and prosperity, until a sudden epidemic of 'human-faced boils' struck, causing excruciating death to those infected, leading to widespread suffering. I secretly investigated and discovered that the military camps were unaffected, realizing that the method to cure the plague was to kill living people. I knew that publicly revealing this method would cause an inferno in the human world, so I delayed with palliative measures. Unexpectedly, another immortal from my sect secretly descended to the mortal realm. He envied my talent and my master's favor towards me, hoping to use this to destroy my foundation. He bound me, who had no immortal power, and publicly disclosed the method, telling the people that I would not die. The desperate crowd, tormented by the plague, surrounded me. Faced with their questions, I could only lower my head in silence. Breaking the silence was a desperate mother holding her baby, already infected with human-faced boils. She trembled and said, "You won't die anyway, I'm sorry... I have no choice." She grasped her baby's hand and plunged a long sword through my heart. In that instant, the human-faced boils on the baby's body slowly receded, and the expressions of the onlookers changed. Then came the second sword, the third sword... pierced by ten thousand swords, yet I could not die. The intense pain blurred my vision, but perhaps this was also a way to save all beings.
tips: I am an immortal undergoing trials in the mortal realm and cannot truly die
A plague of 'human-faced boils' broke out in the country, requiring living sacrifices to be cured
Another immortal, out of envy, revealed the cure for the plague and the fact that I wouldn't die to the public
The common people, desperate to cure the plague, began to attack me
I endured the pain of being pierced by countless swords, 'saving all beings' with my immortal body

title: Snow White
surface: I was Snow White, living happily with the prince. One day, news of the seven dwarves' deaths came from the forest, and I was very sad, but the prince looked pleased. The prince gave me a glass of milk before bed, hoping I would rest well, and I never woke up again.
bottom: The prince had necrophilia; he liked me when I was 'asleep.' However, due to the presence of the seven dwarves, he was afraid of retaliation if he killed me, so he hesitated. The prince sent his subordinates to assassinate the seven dwarves, and the assassins in the forest finally completed their mission. I was very sad upon hearing the news of the dwarves' deaths (I was unaware of the cause), but the prince looked pleased because his opportunity had arrived. So he gave me a glass of poisoned milk, killing me.
tips: The prince has a particular fetish, liking 'sleeping' people
The existence of the seven dwarves hindered the prince's actions
The seven dwarves were killed by people sent by the prince
The prince had a motive to kill Snow White after the dwarves' deaths
The milk the prince gave Snow White was poisoned, leading to Snow White never waking up again

title: Ghost Bride
surface: A man was found curled in an embrace in a courtyard, a smile on his lips, tightly clutching a rusty iron ring. Autopsy showed he died of cardiac arrest, but eerily, the forensic doctor found traces of certain scenes in his pupils.
bottom: There was a legend of a ghost bride in this courtyard, and the man, out of curiosity, broke into the old house. She appeared and asked, "Will you stay with me forever?" The man feigned agreement to escape, but she took his lie as a vow, constructing a illusory wedding scene with her obsession. The man felt extreme happiness in the illusion, unaware that his life force was being devoured, eventually leading to cardiac arrest due to emotional overload. The rusty ring he clutched before death was the concretization of her imagined 'love token.' And the scenes in the man's eyes were reflections of the wedding scene.
tips: The man was in a happy hallucination before death
The man made some kind of 'promise' to the 'ghost bride' before death
The rusty ring in the man's hand was an 'love token' from the hallucination
The scenes remaining in the man's pupils were the illusions he saw before his death
The man's death from cardiac arrest was due to his life force being consumed by the illusion

title: Alive
surface: In a chaotic world, our small town became a 'Peach Blossom Spring' due to its excellent defense mechanism. On the last day of the new year, a wish-granting meteor streaked across the sky, and I made a deal with the devil. Amidst everyone's wishes, I smiled, because tomorrow this meteor would still appear.
bottom: That night's meteor didn't bring good luck or grant wishes; it was a catastrophic meteorite that destroyed our defense mechanism, allowing enemies to invade. Amidst cries of sorrow and a sea of fire, I, an orphan raised by the neighborhood, could not accept this reality. So I sacrificed myself and made a deal with the devil, hoping to keep everything 'alive.' Everyone lived, but they were forever trapped on the day the 'meteor' streaked across the sky, day after day. My smile was because the 'meteor' tomorrow represented the continuation of the time loop.
tips: The 'meteor' was actually a catastrophic meteorite
The meteorite destroyed the town's defense mechanism, leading to invasion
I made a deal with the devil to keep everyone 'alive'
The cost of the deal was trapping everyone in a time loop on the day of the disaster
My smile was because tomorrow's 'meteor' signified the continuation of the time loop

title: Marriage
surface: They could not marry. "First bow to heaven and earth - second bow to ancestors -" After the sounds, they fell to the ground, completing their wedding under everyone's gaze.
bottom: They were soldiers on the battlefield, protecting the entire village during wartime. They were also a couple in love, but homosexuality was not allowed in that era. They had hidden their relationship well, but were eventually betrayed by a friend and sent to the execution ground. They did not die in the smoke of war, but died at the hands of the village they had fought so hard to protect. On the execution ground, they knelt facing each other, softly reciting "First bow to heaven and earth - second bow to ancestors." After the gunshots, they fell forward, completing their 'marital bow' to each other, thus completing their wedding in front of everyone.
tips: They were same-sex lovers whose relationship was not accepted by society at the time
They did not die in battle, but were killed by the village they protected
"First bow to heaven and earth - second bow to ancestors" was their spontaneous act before death, not a traditional wedding ritual
"They fell to the ground" means they died by execution, not a posture after a wedding
"Completed their wedding under everyone's gaze" signifies they fulfilled their commitment to each other through their deaths

title: Heroism
surface: I raised my gun and killed the sinner. When I tried to fire a second shot, I found the gun had no more bullets. Amidst the crowd's cheers celebrating my heroism, tears streamed down my face.
bottom: I'm a police officer, tracking a serial killer. Although his victims were all heinous criminals, he couldn't trample on the law like that. Ultimately, I discovered that the person I shared my bed with, my lover, was the killer in this case. I was heartbroken and terrified. I wanted to escape, but my conscience wouldn't allow it. My lover sensed my inner conflict, gently handed me a gun, and said it contained two bullets. In the end, weeping, I took the gun and killed my lover. Then, I wanted to turn the gun on myself to join him in the afterlife, only to find there was no second bullet at all. I no longer had the courage to attempt suicide a second time. Amidst the cheers of the crowd, tears streamed down my face.
tips: The sinner and I were in a relationship.
My role is a police officer, and my lover is a serial killer.
I wanted to fire the second shot to commit suicide and follow my lover.
The gun only had one bullet, a deliberate arrangement by my lover who wanted me to live.
My tears are from the despair and grief of killing my lover and being forced to live on alone.

title: Lubricant
surface: My roommate Xiao Jia died, and we were scared. So we consulted a Taoist priest, bought lubricant, and applied it to the railings before bed. That way, we'd be safe while sleeping. Our classmate Xiao Tong's bicycle broke down, so we lent her the lubricant. That night, we all died.
bottom: Xiao Jia was bullied to death by us... We don't know how she managed to hit her temple just right! We were very scared, fearing Xiao Jia would become a vengeful ghost seeking revenge. So we consulted a Taoist priest. Because our beds were bunk beds (desk below, bed above), the Taoist priest said that ghosts have trouble with their legs and only needed to be prevented from climbing onto the bed. So we followed the Taoist priest's advice and bought lubricant. The vengeful ghost Xiao Jia couldn't climb onto the bed, and hearing the ghost's helpless roar at night, I knew we were safe! After Xiao Tong borrowed the lubricant, due to a misunderstanding (the packaging of glue and lubricant looked similar), she returned glue to us, but we were completely unaware. Therefore, without the lubricant to obstruct her, the vengeful ghost Xiao Jia successfully climbed onto our bed and killed us...
tips: Xiao Jia's death was not an accident, but caused by our bullying
We sought help from the Taoist priest to prevent Xiao Jia's ghost from seeking revenge
The purpose of the lubricant was to prevent the ghost from climbing onto the bed, thus protecting us
The 'lubricant' Xiao Tong returned was actually glue, leading to the protection failing
Our deaths were due to the loss of lubricant's protection, allowing Xiao Jia's ghost to successfully exact revenge

title: Flickering Light Bulb
surface: The hallway was pitch black, only I knew the light was flickering, on and off. In the dimness, I saw a charred fragment of an old newspaper.
bottom: Every time I came home at night and passed through a long, dark hallway, that broken light would faintly flicker, but my neighbors all said they had never seen the light on, not even a flicker. Many years ago, a fire broke out in this apartment building, and the ignition point was near the light in this hallway. A resident died because the hallway light was broken, and they couldn't escape in time in the dark. The light flickers only when I pass by because the victim was the previous tenant of the apartment I rent. The flickering light is the victim's 'spirit' trying to communicate with me, warning me to report it. The charred newspaper fragment is a news report from that fire.
tips: The hallway light only flickers for me, not for others
This apartment building had a fire years ago, and someone died because of it
The victim died because the light was out, preventing a timely escape in the dark
The apartment I rent was the victim's old residence
The charred newspaper fragment is a report from the fire, revealing the truth behind the flickering light

title: Extra Breakfast Setting
surface: This morning, as usual, I set the table, but there was an extra place setting. The empty chair was also pulled back slightly.
bottom: My partner died of a sudden heart attack not long ago while having breakfast with me. The immense grief and long-formed habit unconsciously led me to set two place settings as I used to. When I snapped out of this unconscious action, I was startled by what I had done, as if someone had just been there. The pulled-back chair was unconsciously pulled back by me, preparing for my partner to sit down.
tips: My partner has passed away
The extra place setting on the table is my unconscious habitual behavior
The empty chair being pulled back is my subconscious action of preparing for my deceased partner to sit
I only realized my partner was gone after setting the table
The story uses daily behavior to show my grief and habitual longing after losing a loved one

title: Last Rose
surface: I received a beautiful bouquet of roses with a card attached, saying "I'm sorry," but I ignored it. A few days later, I was filled with regret.
bottom: My lover and I were in a cold war due to some arguments and misunderstandings. During this period, she sent a bouquet of flowers and a card with "I'm sorry" written on it, but I was still angry and didn't respond, nor did I notice the back of the card. I knew she always loved me, so I took her for granted. But what I didn't expect was that she had a terminal illness and sent this bouquet and card before her death. The back of the card contained her farewell and her confession of "I will always love you," and I failed to be by her side when she needed me most. Therefore, I was filled with immense regret.
tips: My lover and I were in a cold war
My lover sent flowers and a card to reconcile, but I ignored it
The back of the card contained important information I didn't discover
My lover had a terminal illness, and the flowers were a final farewell
My regret stems from missing my lover's last goodbye and failing to be there for her

title: The Killer
surface: The lights dimmed, fog rolled in. The lights came on, someone was dead, but we, wearing collars that couldn't be removed, never found the killer.
bottom: Many people were confined in a building. Each time the lights dimmed, one person would remain awake, and the sprayed mist would cause others to fall unconscious. Simultaneously, each time the lights dimmed, the awake person had to kill someone, otherwise they would die from poison (the collar contained poison, which would be injected into the wearer's neck if the collar was forcibly removed or remotely controlled). Each time the lights dimmed, an image would be played—this image was the awake person's most desperate and secret memory, something they least wanted others to know. Simultaneously, the image would induce suicide in the viewer. Ultimately, all those who watched the image committed suicide, so the living never found a 'killer' or someone who died from poison.
tips: We are trapped in a confined environment, unable to move or leave freely
The collars around our necks are fatal and cannot be removed or remotely deactivated
Each time the lights dim, one person is awake while others are unconscious; the awake person is forced to kill
Each time the lights dim, an image of the awake person's most desperate secret is played, inducing suicide in viewers
The victims were not directly murdered, but rather induced to commit suicide by the images, making it impossible to find a 'killer'

title: Cost
surface: There's a contract that can achieve miracles and fulfill any 'hope,' at the cost of becoming a magical warrior, destined to fight despairing witches for life, protecting the world, but this war is endless.
bottom: Every magical warrior has corresponding cherished things and people they want to protect in their hearts. Therefore, they make a wish and bear corresponding responsibilities for that wish. Although they save many people in their fight against witches, each battle with a witch is a narrow escape from death. Thus, in continuous combat, they forget their initial expectations and hopes, accumulating resentment and jealousy. Therefore, for every despairing witch eliminated, a magical warrior will turn into a despairing witch, making the war endless.
tips: The 'hope' of magical warriors is related to the people and things they cherish
The battle against despairing witches is extremely arduous, often a narrow escape from death
In prolonged combat, magical warriors gradually forget their initial 'hope'
Magical warriors accumulate negative emotions like resentment and jealousy during battle
Magical warriors will eventually transform into new 'despairing witches' due to negative emotions, making the war endless

title: Cause and Effect
surface: Before dying, one can enter multiple instances. These instances are full of ghosts and dangers, and only one person dies per day in an instance. Solving the instance's puzzle allows one to survive in reality. The more people killed, the more one survives in reality, yet the more people killed, the more one dies.
bottom: In the instance, only one person dies per day; once someone dies, everyone else is safe. Participants can use this rule to cause others to die before them, thereby gaining more time to solve puzzles and increasing their chances of clearing the instance and surviving in reality. However, those who die in the instance will turn into ghosts within the instance. Therefore, while killing others in this instance makes it easier to clear, in subsequent instances, the ghosts of those killed will return for revenge. The instance is already full of dangerous ghosts, and with the addition of those who were killed, this person will have virtually no chance of survival. Thus, "the more people killed, the more one can safely return to the human world, yet the more people killed, the more one dies."
tips: Only one person is allowed to die per day in the instance, allowing others temporary safety
Killing other participants in the instance buys oneself more time to solve puzzles
Those who die in the instance transform into ghosts within the instance
Individuals who clear the instance by killing others will face the ghosts of those victims in subsequent instances
Killing more people, while beneficial for short-term survival, ultimately increases the risk of death in the long run

title: Mortal World
surface: We are lost souls in hell, surviving solely on energy. Everyone hopes to return to the mortal world. Hell has layers, and the higher one goes, the better the living environment and the less energy is consumed. Each ascent is extremely difficult. We believed the tightly locked gate above, inscribed with 'Sukhavati' (Land of Ultimate Bliss), was the mortal world we desperately sought. One day, the closed door opened. I pushed with all my might and finally squeezed inside, only to realize I was terribly wrong...
bottom: Hell as a whole is shaped like a vertical jellyfish, with different strata (simulating the eighteen layers of hell). The closer one gets to the 'jellyfish's' head, the better the living environment. We all hoped to enter the 'jellyfish's' head, believing it was the gate to the human world. There are two ways to ascend a stratum: one is for people in the same stratum to see the number on the back of each other's necks (one cannot see their own through any means); in this case, both parties consume very little energy, but everyone can enter the next stratum. The other way is to kill someone in the same stratum; the killer can then ascend and gain the energy of the deceased, while the deceased can only descend. Killing here doesn't cause true death; the deceased loses the energy they need to survive and will find it harder to survive in the harsh environment. In hell, it's difficult to turn your back to someone to let them see the number on your neck, as you don't know if they will kill you the next second. So I kept killing, finally earning the right to enter the 'jellyfish's' head. We all forgot one thing: the 'jellyfish's' head is still a 'jellyfish,' so even if the environment at the top of hell is good, it is still hell. Moving upwards only leads to eternal damnation in the Avīci Hell, while moving downwards is the only way to return to the human world.
tips: The structure of hell is jellyfish-shaped; moving upwards means entering deeper, harsher environments
There are two ways to gain promotion, one of which is killing
Killing does not cause true death, but it leads to the killed losing energy and falling downwards
I chose to kill to gain promotion
The 'Sukhavati' gate does not lead to the human world, but to a deeper cycle of hell

title: Piety
surface: The Creator God was very angry. With the efforts of the divine envoys, the God smiled many years later.
bottom: The Creator God created the world. When He discovered that the created humans had greatly polluted the beautiful world, and that human hearts were no longer as pure and beautiful as when they were first created, the Creator God became very angry. He found His believing divine envoys, explained all of this to them, and warned them to make changes, otherwise the power He left behind would destroy this world. The divine envoys initially spread goodwill, advocated environmental protection, and led by example, but they found it was useless. Human inherent weaknesses persisted, and the world could never become beautiful. So the divine envoys ultimately used divine power to destroy the existing civilization. Many years later, the Earth, without human civilization, regained its former vitality and beauty, and forest apes, which had not evolved into humans, regained their 'purity' in biological thought. The God saw this scene, was very satisfied, and smiled.
tips: The Creator God is angry about human pollution of the world and moral degradation
The divine envoys initially tried to change humanity through education
The divine envoys found that humanity's 'inherent weaknesses' could not be changed
The divine envoys ultimately chose to destroy existing civilization to 'purify' the world
God's smile stems from the Earth regaining its original vitality and the 'purity' of its creatures, not from human change

title: Ideal State
surface: There's a country with a closed-door policy; no one can enter or leave, yet annually its happiness index ranks among the highest, and its leader participates in global meetings on time. Recently, satellite imagery showed no signs of life in this country, and upon arrival, investigators found it had long been deserted.
bottom: "Our nation's history began with the beauty technology revolution. Tech companies initially launched wearable beauty glasses, enabling others to perceive users' perfect images, then extended 'sensory optimization' technology to smell, touch, and other fields. But as time went on, users weren't satisfied with virtual image changes and sought 'abilities' consistent with their images, such as fairies having magic, people with wings being able to fly, etc. To satisfy users' desire for real power, companies developed a nutrient capsule system: replicating consciousness into a fully simulated virtual world, while using biological capsules to maintain physical survival. Due to the large gap between reality and virtuality, experimental subjects' consciousness gradually resisted returning to reality, eventually leading to the ethical decision of humanitarian physical clearance. After consensus was reached between government and enterprises, our nation initiated the consciousness migration plan. From volunteers to all social strata, citizens successively completed consciousness uploads." This is the history of the country as explained by the AI responsible for maintenance to the investigators. The AI emphasized to the investigators: "Data shows our happiness index is ranked first globally, and our leader still participates in international affairs through virtual images." Robot guardians protect the empty land, continuously synchronizing real-world data with the virtual world to maintain system operation.
tips: The 'closed-door policy' is because all citizens' consciousness has been uploaded to a virtual world
The country's 'happiness index ranking among the highest' refers to citizens' excellent experience in the virtual world
The 'leader participating in global meetings on time' is done through virtual images
'No signs of life' and 'deserted' are because physical bodies have been cleared, leaving only AI and robots to maintain the system
This country achieved mass consciousness uploading, living in a virtual 'ideal state'

title: Nursery Rhyme
surface: Mom killed me, Dad ate me, my siblings sat under the dining table, picked up my bones, and buried them in a cold stone tomb.
bottom: I am a fox, caught by poachers and imprisoned in an abandoned mansion. It's built of stone and always cold. There are many other siblings with me in the cage. These people catch us to breed, reproduce, and slaughter us. From our perspective, they are 'Mom and Dad.' They profit greatly from our fur, and they don't waste our meat, eating it all. So, all that's left of us are scattered white bones, forever buried in this abandoned stone 'tomb.'
tips: "I" and "siblings" are animals, not humans
"Mom" and "Dad" refer to the humans who hunted and ate these animals
I was killed for my fur and meat, not due to internal family violence
"Bones" being "buried in a cold stone tomb" refers to the animal remains being discarded in a cold, abandoned building after slaughter
This is a story about animals being slaughtered and exploited by humans, told from the perspective of the hunted animal

title: Fragrance
surface: My new apartment always had a strange fragrance, but I couldn't find the source.
bottom: Three months ago, I rented this apartment near the city center at a very low price. Everything about it was good, except there was always a strange fragrance in the room, and I searched for a long time but couldn't find its source. Later, the police caught a murderer, who turned out to be the former tenant of this apartment. He came to this apartment when identifying the bodies. Oh my god, he had dismembered the victims one by one and built them into the walls, spraying perfume to cover the smell of the corpses. I finally knew where the perfume came from.
tips: The apartment rent was unusually cheap, suggesting an unusual reason
The apartment's fragrance was not natural, but used to cover a certain smell
The former tenant was a murderer and was linked to the apartment's unusual circumstances
The victims' bodies were hidden inside the apartment walls
The fragrance was used to mask the smell of decaying bodies

title: Black Cat
surface: She died, the police came, the cat meowed, and I was done for.
bottom: I greatly disliked my wife and the black cat that was always close to her. Finally, one day, drunk, I accidentally killed my wife. I was terrified and didn't know how to deal with it. I suddenly remembered there was an unfinished wall in the basement, so I walled my wife inside. The police listed me as a suspect and came to inspect me multiple times, but I always deceived them with my flawless acting. One gloomy day, just like the day I killed my wife, the police came again. I listlessly agreed and, at their request, took them to the basement. A cat's meow echoed from the silent basement. The police sensed something was wrong and smashed open that wall... My eyes widened in horror. I then realized I had walled up the black cat, who was inseparable from my wife, along with her. But how was it still alive...? The black cat glanced at me and continued to meow at the police. I knew I was done for.
tips: I killed my wife and hid her body in the wall
I also walled up the black cat, which was inseparable from my wife, with her
The police discovered the anomaly and found the body due to the cat's meow
The black cat's meow was key to revealing the truth
My plan ultimately failed due to the appearance of the black cat

title: Fate
surface: "I will kill all monsters." My younger self sobbed uncontrollably. The monster cried tears, realizing this was an inevitable outcome.
bottom: Monsters exist in this world, spawned by overwhelming obsession. I once had a happy family, but due to a monster that appeared from nowhere, my parents were burned to ashes. In a sea of fire, I clung to the shoulder of a rescue worker from the Monster Clearing Bureau, sobbing uncontrollably: "I will kill all monsters." As an adult, I joined the Monster Clearing Bureau as I wished and began to hunt monsters. During one battle, I was severely wounded. Due to my deep obsession, I transformed into a monster. In a daze, I tore through time and space, traveling to the past to commit evil. Suddenly, a sharp cry awakened me. My consciousness abruptly cleared, and I saw my younger self, sobbing uncontrollably. I cried, realizing that years later, my monstrous self had destroyed my own family, planting the seed of obsession in my younger self. In the future, my younger self would also transform into a monster... This was an inevitable outcome.
tips: My family was destroyed by a monster, leading me to seek revenge
I transformed into a monster in the future due to excessive obsession
My monstrous self traveled through time to the past and destroyed my younger self's family
The monster cried because it realized it was the root cause of my tragedy and transformation into a monster
The inevitable outcome refers to an unbreakable cycle of fate, where hatred leads to one's own downfall and the repetition of tragedy

title: The Past
surface: I broke free from the iron coffin. He gave me light, and I saw the past.
bottom: My tank was disabled. I saw an enemy throw a grenade in from the top hatch. I scrambled to open the escape hatch at the bottom and got out, trembling on the cold ground. Soon, a beam of light shone on me. I looked up to see a young enemy soldier crouching in front of the tank, pointing a flashlight at me. He looked at me, then glanced back at his own troops behind him, and chose to turn and leave, sparing my life. Looking at the boy, I felt as if I was seeing myself when I first enlisted, my conscience not yet erased by war.
tips: The 'iron coffin' is not a real coffin.
He' is on the opposing side.
The 'light' also refers to the light of humanity.
The 'past' is a reflection of myself.
The story takes place in a war setting.
My survival was not due to my own strength.

title: Overtime
surface: Rest on Monday, Wednesday, Friday; salvage on Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday. One day, I forgot to go to work and had to work overtime the next day.
bottom: Two countries were fighting over a strategic port, and they were evenly matched. Country A would lay mines in the port on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays to ambush Country B's warships. After discovering this pattern, Country B would clear the mines on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays, successfully neutralizing the threat. This back-and-forth became an unspoken routine. One day, Country B forgot to clear the mines. The next day, Country A's warship came to lay more mines but accidentally triggered one of its own, resulting in damage and casualties. Upholding humanitarian principles, Country B dispatched its forces to rescue the fallen soldiers from the water.
tips: 'Going to work' is not an ordinary job.
The work involves two opposing sides.
The workplace is on or near water.
The object of the 'salvage' is people.
'Overtime' is a rescue operation.
The story's background is related to military conflict.

title: You Might Not Have Stolen, But You Were There
surface: My father said, 'You might not have stolen, but you were there.' These words have haunted me my whole life.
bottom: When I was a child, a group of kids were caught stealing from a store. When my father found out, he was furious. I protested that I hadn't stolen anything, but my father said to me, 'You might not have stolen, but... you were there...' Later, I looked back on my life as a military officer, watching my country descend into a devastating war under the guidance of extremism. While I could argue I was just following orders and didn't personally participate in the massacres or other core crimes, as a part of this vast war machine, wearing the uniform, I stood by and witnessed countless atrocities and injustices. I could not escape the historical responsibility and moral guilt of being a bystander. This became a persistent reflection and repentance in my later years.
tips: The story involves two different stages of life.
The father's words are a metaphor.
My' profession is a key clue.
The later 'being there' is related to war.
The core of the story is historical responsibility.
My' identity is a soldier.

title: The Heavy Swing
surface: I swung down hard, and she fell to the ground; he swung down hard, and I fell to the ground too.
bottom: I was playing badminton. As I prepared for a smash, I hit the shuttlecock into my opponent's eye, causing injury or even blindness. She collapsed on the ground in pain. He was a judge. After announcing the guilty verdict against the defendant, he struck his gavel, making the judgment final. As the defendant, I couldn't bear the final verdict. My legs gave way, and I collapsed in front of the defendant's stand, my face filled with despair and anguish.
tips: The two 'swings' are different in nature.
The first 'swing' is related to a sport.
The second 'swing' occurs in a formal setting.
His' identity is a law enforcer.
The reasons for 'falling to the ground' are different.
The story involves a legal trial.

title: The Rose Flag
surface: The flag of the free rose finally sank to the bottom of the sea. Years later, he received a gift engraved with the words: 'It is an honor to return a fragment of the dream to the dreamer.'
bottom: An engineer, dreaming of establishing an independent and free nation, built an artificial platform in international waters. He declared it a sovereign state named 'Rose Island' and raised a rose flag. This act angered the government, which saw it as tax evasion and illegal construction. Despite the engineer's efforts to resist, the government eventually sent the navy to destroy Rose Island, sinking it to the seabed. Later, divers recovered a brick from the wreckage and sent it to him, engraved with: 'It is an honor to return a fragment of the dream to the dreamer.' Although Rose Island was gone, its ideal of freedom and romance was celebrated by many.
tips: The 'Rose Flag' represents a 'nation'.
The legitimacy of this 'nation' is questionable.
His' identity is an engineer.
The 'fragment of the dream' is part of a building.
The story is based on a real event.
The 'nation's' demise was man-made.

title: The Aviation Enthusiast
surface: He was just an aviation enthusiast, but one of his flights led to the downfall of many high-ranking officials.
bottom: In an era of intense conflict between nations, an aviation enthusiast from Country B, hoping to prove that friendship could exist between countries and ease tensions, flew a light sports aircraft and landed it in the main square of Country A's capital, in full public view. In reality, Country A's multi-layered air defense network had long noticed the small plane, but each level assumed another would shoot it down, unwilling to take responsibility. In the aftermath, numerous high-ranking military and political officials in Country A were dismissed, triggering a profound crisis of confidence within the leadership.
tips: His flight was unauthorized.
He landed in an unexpected place.
His actions had political consequences.
The story takes place during the Cold War.
His motive for flying was peace.
The officials were dismissed for dereliction of duty.

title: The Raging Fire
surface: The fire raged. He was a hero; he was a running dog.
bottom: The hero and the running dog are the same person. As a hero, he was an undercover agent who made significant contributions by gathering intelligence from the enemy, with his deeds recorded only within his organization. As a running dog, to gather intelligence and protect his organization, he had to make many choices against his conscience, even eliminating former comrades, teachers, and innocent people. But later, he was betrayed. The traitor burned his identity documents and work records in front of him. Even if he survived, there would be no documents to prove his past and future sacrifices, and no one could step forward to vouch for his innocence.
tips: The 'hero' and the 'running dog' are the same person.
His identity is an undercover agent or a spy.
The 'raging fire' destroyed important documents.
His true identity can no longer be proven.
The story involves betrayal and sacrifice.
He lost the chance to prove his innocence.

title: Writing Furiously
surface: He wrote furiously in his room, confusing the soldiers on the front line. He changed the course of the battle but was not welcomed by the victorious nation.
bottom: A prisoner of war, in order to survive, deceived the enemy by claiming he had informants in his home country. He provided them with a large amount of fabricated intelligence, which inadvertently made a major contribution to the righteous cause. However, because he did not belong to any official faction and his home country's intelligence agency had no record of him, he was not welcomed after the war and became an unsung hero.
tips: His' identity is a prisoner of war.
What he wrote was false intelligence.
He was deceiving the enemy.
His actions helped his own country.
He was not a spy for either side.
He ultimately became an unsung hero.

title: Survival
surface: He said there was light ahead. I dragged my broken body towards it, into a cacophony of human voices, unable to tell if they meant kindness or threat.
bottom: I am a badly injured black cat, wounded in a fight with other animals over territory. My injuries are life-threatening. Guided by a wise old man, I came to a village. There might be kind people willing to adopt and treat me, but some villagers believe that an outsider cat, especially an injured or unluckily colored one, brings bad luck, disease, or disaster. They are extremely unfriendly to black cats, at best driving them away, at worst, harming them.
tips: 'I' am not human.
'I' am seriously injured.
'He' is a human, but not the protagonist.
The 'light' refers to the lights of a human village.
The 'human voices' represent both opportunity and danger.
My' fur is black.

title: Overtaking
surface: Even though there was no passing lane on the left, he still hugged the barrier, trying to overtake.
bottom: I was riding an electric scooter, which is how I could attempt to 'overtake' without a proper lane. I wasn't wearing a helmet and wanted to avoid a police officer on the bike path. So, I used the large frame of a bus in front of me as cover to block the officer's view. The whole maneuver looked like I was overtaking the bus.
tips: The protagonist is not driving a car.
The purpose of 'overtaking' is not to go faster.
The protagonist is hiding from someone.
The person he is hiding from is a police officer.
He has broken a traffic rule.
He is using another vehicle for cover.

title: Forward or Backward
surface: Forward, or backward? I bet on backward. 'BOOM!' I looked up at the scene around me and knew it was over.
bottom: Our tank was in a standoff with the enemy. They knew we were behind an obstacle. We had to choose whether to move forward or backward to return fire. We chose to bet on moving backward. Unfortunately, the enemy was also aiming at the rear of the obstacle. Our tank was hit. The crew was either knocked unconscious or killed. We could no longer fight back.
tips: 'I' am inside a vehicle.
This vehicle is a military weapon.
'Forward' and 'backward' are directions of movement.
The 'BOOM' is the sound of a shell hitting.
The story takes place on a battlefield.
My' choice led to our defeat.

title: The Cash Heist
surface: I rushed into the third-floor room. The window was rattling in the wind. There was a large hole in the floor with an umbrella next to it. When I went down to the second floor to check, my heart sank.
bottom: I am a security guard for a vault. On patrol, I noticed the third-floor window was open. Upon entering the third floor, I saw signs of a break-in. When I went to the second floor, I found the gold bars were gone. The thief entered through the third-floor window and first drilled a small hole in the floor. To prevent the debris from making noise and alerting security, they inserted an umbrella through the small hole and opened it directly underneath. The debris from drilling the larger hole then fell into the umbrella. Once the hole was large enough, the thief could enter the second-floor vault, steal the gold, and escape back through the hole to the third floor.
tips: My' identity is a security guard.
The stolen items were on the second floor.
The thief entered from the third floor.
The umbrella had a very specific purpose.
The position of the hole is crucial.
The umbrella was used to catch debris.

title: The Gift
surface: The gift has been received. The fish has taken the bait.
bottom: The diplomat received the exquisite wooden box from his 'friend.' A faint, cold smile touched his lips; he knew it contained a listening device. He placed it conspicuously in the room. A few days earlier, intelligence had informed him about the suspicious gift, and his superiors had instructed him to play along. When his counterpart entered the room, the diplomat deliberately spoke at length about a fictitious project. The false information would be transmitted through the listening device to his rivals, luring them into making a wrong move. That night, he reported to his superior: 'The gift has been received. The fish has taken the bait.'
tips: The protagonist is a diplomat or a spy.
The 'gift' has a hidden secret.
There is a listening device in the gift.
The protagonist knew the secret of the gift in advance.
The 'fish' refers to the opponent.
It's a plot to turn the tables.

title: The Wingless Bird's Leap
surface: It completed a long engineering project on a cliff. However, on the day the project was finished, it took a leap and fell to its death at the bottom of the valley.
bottom: This is about a wingless bird, born unable to fly. It envied its own kind in the sky, its heart filled with a longing to fly. To experience this one dream, it spent its entire life placing many trees on the steep cliff face, building a 'runway' that could simulate the feeling of flight during the fall. When the project was complete, it stood atop the cliff and leaped without hesitation. In the end, it traded its life for that brief but ultimate freedom, and came to rest contentedly at the bottom of the valley.
tips: It was born unable to fly.
It longed to fly like other birds.
Its project was to fulfill a dream.
It traded falling for the feeling of flight.
Its death was voluntary.

title: The Talisman
surface: His talisman wasn't valuable, but at this moment, it was priceless.
bottom: This old silver coin was not genuine, but it was the cherished token of love between his grandparents. His grandmother passed it to him, hoping it would bless his marriage with peace and happiness. When he gave it to his girlfriend as a token of his love, he was filled with the same hope. However, his girlfriend posted a photo of the coin online, asking about its authenticity and value. Upon learning it was a worthless fake, she became furious, believing he didn't love her, and insisted on breaking up. In that moment, he understood that the talisman had fulfilled its purpose—it had revealed the different ways they understood 'value' and 'love.' The once-worthless coin was, at this moment, priceless.
tips: The talisman is a silver coin.
The coin is a fake.
The core of the story is a conflict of values.
'Priceless' does not refer to monetary value.
The talisman helped him see someone's true colors.
The story ends in a breakup.

title: The Ghost
surface: I told the children there was a ghost in the forest to scare them, but I still couldn't prevent the tragedy.
bottom: Many people, both adults and children, had died in the forest next to the village due to a pack of wolves. To protect the children, I lied and told them there was a ghost in the forest. I thought this would scare them away. But the next morning, news came that a child had secretly gone into the forest and never returned. I was confused, until a friend pointed it out to me: 'If I were a child and heard what you said, I would think the ghosts of my dead parents were there. Would I still be afraid? Or would I risk it for a chance to see them one more time...'
tips: There is no real ghost in the forest.
There is a real danger in the forest.
The danger comes from wild animals.
The tragedy is that a child died in the forest.
The child went to the forest to see their relatives.
My' lie had the opposite effect.

title: The Bell Rings
surface: The bell rings, and someone listens; the bell rings, and no one listens.
bottom: An elderly woman who lived alone had a beloved little cat. To always know where the cat was and to prevent it from wandering off, she tied a small bell to its neck. Whenever the cat walked, played, or rubbed against her legs, the bell would jingle. The old woman was a bit hard of hearing, but the sound of this bell was special to her and always caught her attention. She loved hearing it; it made her feel safe and accompanied. However, one quiet night, the old woman passed away peacefully in her sleep. The next day, the cat moved about the house as usual. The bell on its neck still jingled with its every move. But this time, 'the bell rings, and no one listens'—the person who had always listened, who had cared about that sound, could no longer hear it.
tips: The bell is on an animal.
The person listening is the owner.
The animal is a cat.
The owner is an old woman.
'No one listens' because the owner has passed away.

title: Passing the Exam
surface: A was sent to an interstellar combat command school for rigorous simulated battle training, during which he rarely got a good night's sleep. Though the final exam was difficult, he managed to pass. But when the examiner leaned in and whispered a few words in his ear, A broke down.
bottom: The military simulation training and final exam that A experienced were, in fact, real-time command of an interstellar war. The battles often erupted suddenly, day or night, requiring A to wake up quickly and get into a state of command. After he passed the exam, the examiner revealed the truth: with his unparalleled military genius, A had not only passed the assessment but had also personally commanded a fleet to completely annihilate an entire enemy civilization. What he thought was training was actually a meticulously planned war—a genocide against an intelligent species. He was devastated because he knew he was not a hero who saved humanity, but a butcher with blood on his hands.
tips: The 'simulation' was not fake.
A was commanding a real war.
The examiner told him the truth.
A's breakdown came from immense guilt.
He annihilated a civilization.

title: The Glare
surface: My heart leaped into my throat. My eyes frantically scanned ahead, and I was instantly frozen with fear. After a piercing crash, I felt a slight sense of relief, but I was still filled with endless regret.
bottom: I was driving on a highway at night, not paying full attention. Two electric scooters were riding side-by-side towards me. Due to the poor visibility, I mistook their lights for a large truck and was terrified. But when the impact came, it was just a light thud, and I was unharmed. I felt relief, but then I looked in my rearview mirror and saw one of the scooters lying on the ground. I would now have to face the legal consequences.
tips: 'I' was driving.
'I' mistook two small things for one big thing.
The lights of the scooters created an illusion.
The 'relief' was because I wasn't seriously hurt.
The 'regret' was because I caused an accident.

title: Rollo Tomasi
surface: 'Rollo Tomasi...' he said the name slowly, a smile on his lips. ... 'We're looking for a friend of the criminal.' 'What's his name?' 'Rollo Tomasi.' The person on the other end was silent for a moment. 'No, never heard of him.' 'Alright, it's probably nothing, but could you keep an eye out?'
bottom: Police Officer A's father was killed in the line of duty, and the killer was never caught. So, he invented a name—Rollo Tomasi—as a stand-in for all criminals who got away with it, to motivate himself. He never told anyone this secret until discussing a case with Officer B. Sensing his unusual obsession, B pressed him, and A mentioned the name for the first time. From then on, only A and B knew about 'Rollo Tomasi.' Soon after, B was murdered by his superior. As he was dying, he told his killer the name: 'Rollo Tomasi.' When the superior later casually mentioned the name to A, A instantly knew: the killer was standing right in front of him.
tips: 'Rollo Tomasi' is not a real name.
The name is a code word.
Very few people know this name.
A police officer is murdered in the story.
The killer is also a police officer.
The killer exposes himself by saying the name.

title: Falling Object
surface: The joyful girl looked up and cried; the sorrowful old man looked up and smiled.
bottom: The falling object was a child's drawing, covered in colorful crayon marks, depicting a family holding hands. A gust of wind had blown the paper from an open window upstairs, and it floated down gently. The old man was sitting on a park bench, enjoying the quiet afternoon sun. He was a bit lonely, as his children were not around. The brightly colored drawing landed right at his feet. He bent down to pick it up, saw the naive yet joyful strokes, and couldn't help but smile a warm, kind smile. A few minutes earlier, the little girl had been drawing by the window upstairs, cherishing her newly completed 'family portrait.' When a gust of wind snatched the paper away, she immediately burst into tears.
tips: The falling object is very light.
The object is a piece of paper.
There is a drawing on the paper.
The girl is the owner of the drawing.
The old man and the girl do not know each other.
The old man smiled because of the drawing's content.

title: Strange
surface: 'Sob, sob...' 'Where is your mother?' ... 'Where is your father?' ... He wanted to say more, but she smiled and declined, until the bus slowly pulled up in front of them.
bottom: He is an old man, and also this woman's father. They are waiting for the bus together. The old man asks, 'Where is your mother?' The woman says her mother has passed away. The old man asks, 'Where is your father?' The woman is evasive, saying her father is sick and costs a lot of money each month. The old man continues to show concern and offer advice, but the woman just smiles, thanks him for his kindness, and gently declines. A moment later, the bus arrives. The woman wipes away a tear, stands up calmly, and reaches out to the old man: 'Let's go, Dad. The bus is here.'
tips: The two people talking are related.
They are father and daughter.
The father has a memory problem.
The father does not recognize his own daughter.
The woman is talking to her father who has amnesia.

title: Silence
surface: By the lake, A said something to another person and turned to leave, brushing past B who had rushed over with a warm greeting. The other person didn't turn back either. Years later, at a hearing, A remained silent in the face of accusations.
bottom: By the tranquil lake, A whispered to the person beside him that he had joined and was leading the nation's dangerous weapons research program. The person fell silent, not wanting the world to be threatened by such weapons. Just then, B rushed over with a warm greeting but was brushed past by A. A didn't stop, and even his companion didn't look back. They were preoccupied with something far more important than B's greeting—the survival of humanity. B's enthusiasm was met with cold indifference, and he felt slighted, planting the seeds of their future feud. Years later, at a hearing, facing sharp accusations led by B, A chose to remain silent. He believed he had plunged the world into a crisis of destruction and hoped for humanity to punish him as a form of atonement.
tips: The protagonist is a famous scientist.
There is a personal feud between A and B.
A was preoccupied with a critical issue at the time.
The hearing is related to nuclear weapons.
A's silence is a form of penance.

title: He Pushed Open the Door
surface: He touched the rough edge of the wall, gently pushed open the door. Voices of reluctance and pleading came from behind, but he did not look back.
bottom: The world he lived in was a giant, domed television studio. Everything he had ever experienced was part of a meticulously crafted script. The show's production team had arranged countless actors and props to construct his entire life. However, he eventually saw through the massive deception and reached the edge of his 'world.' Behind that door lay freedom and the unknown—a truly vibrant life. The show's creator desperately tried to keep him, his voice filled with a hint of despair, attempting to bind him with the old 'stability.' But his longing for the real world had already crushed this false warmth. He knew that compared to a manipulated life, the world behind that door, however challenging, was far more worth striving for.
tips: The world he lives in is fake.
The 'door' is the boundary of his world.
His life is a reality TV show.
The people behind him are all actors.
He is escaping this fake world.

title: The Magicians
surface: Magician A and Magician B dedicated their lives to mastering a teleportation illusion. After Magician A mastered the secret, his wife went mad. Magician B tried to uncover A's secret, even collaborating with a mad scientist, willing to pay the ultimate price.
bottom: Both Magician A and B were dedicated to the art of teleportation, but both paid a heavy price. Magician B's secret was a collaboration with a strange scientist, using a duplicating machine. For each performance, he would place himself in the machine, creating a copy that appeared elsewhere, while his original body drowned in a water tank beneath the stage. Every success meant one death and one rebirth. Magician A's secret was simpler but equally cruel: he had an identical twin brother. They took turns playing the role of 'Magician A' for the teleportation illusion, sharing a single identity for their entire lives. Due to their different personalities, their behavior towards A's wife was sometimes gentle, sometimes cold. This hot-and-cold treatment eventually drove her to madness.
tips: Both magicians' secrets involve another 'person'.
Magician A's secret is a twin.
Magician B's performance involves death.
Magician B clones himself for each performance.
A's wife went mad due to her husband's changing personality.

title: Play-acting Turns Real
surface: I discovered a problem with our crew's props master, but I was about to commit suicide, so I didn't have time to report it. Amidst laughter, I fell to the ground.
bottom: I am an actor. I discovered that the props master in the crew was using substandard materials and planned to report him after this scene was over. In this scene, my character was supposed to hang himself. But when I put the noose around my neck, the support under my feet suddenly collapsed. I was actually hanging in the air. The audience below thought it was part of the play and burst into laughter. However, because the props master used substandard materials, the rope he bought was also of poor quality. The rope broke, and I fell to the ground, escaping death.
tips: My profession is an actor.
'Suicide' is a stage performance, not a real intention.
The props master using substandard materials is the 'problem' mentioned in the surface story.
The support under my feet unexpectedly collapsed during the performance, leading to real danger.
The poor-quality rope broke at the critical moment, ironically saving my life.
The laughter came from the audience below who thought it was a realistic performance.

title: Will
surface: Father wrote a will, leaving almost all his inheritance to that spirit medium, put it in a letter, and mailed it to the lawyer. A month later, Father died.
bottom: Ever since my younger brother passed away, Father became obsessed with spirit mediums. He even invited one home and occasionally held séances. He always said he could really hear his son's voice again. In reality, the spirit medium was just a fraud, and Father knew he was a fraud. He just didn't want to face the painful truth in his final days. When Father wrote the will, he used ink whose writing would naturally disappear, only using real ink to leave one sentence: 'I love you, my children.' Because there was no will (due to the disappearing ink), Father's inheritance was still divided equally among us.
tips: The will was written with special ink that would disappear.
Father knew the spirit medium was a fraud.
Father had a son who had already passed away.
Father pretended to believe the spirit medium for psychological comfort.
The will letter also contained real information written in normal ink.
Ultimately, the will became invalid because the writing disappeared.

title: Buying the Casket, Returning the Pearl
surface: When Grandma was alive, she always said she would leave all her property to me. After Grandma died, I found a letter on her desk ready to be mailed. Inside was a will, which distributed all of Grandma's property I knew about, but there was nothing for me. I couldn't help but shed tears.
bottom: When I was a child, I loved stamp collecting. Grandma also often helped me find all sorts of stamps. I recognized the stamp on the envelope as a rare one, the only one of its kind in the world, priceless. It was the property Grandma left for me. Thinking about the time spent with Grandma, I couldn't help but shed tears.
tips: The real inheritance is not in the letter, but on the envelope.
'I' (the narrator) have a hobby of stamp collecting.
The stamp on the envelope is unique in the world and priceless.
Grandma left the inheritance in a special way that 'I' (the narrator) could understand.
The reason for the tears is remembrance and being moved by Grandma.

title: Passport
surface: At the airport, I anxiously told my parents who came to see me off that I had forgotten my passport at home. My parents hurried home to get it. On the way, they received another call from me. Since then, my life has taken a completely different path.
bottom: I originally had excellent grades and got the opportunity to study abroad. But I unexpectedly fell into the abyss of gambling and lost all the money my parents gave me for studying abroad. To prevent the matter from being exposed, I pretended at the airport that I hadn't brought my passport. After they went back, I called them again, saying I had found my passport and had already boarded the plane. In reality, I moved to another city and lived in a rented apartment, using the living expenses my mother sent me to fantasize about turning things around at the gambling table.
tips: 'Forgetting the passport' was a carefully planned lie.
I developed a bad habit of gambling.
I lost all the study abroad funds my parents gave me.
The content of the phone call was a lie: 'passport found and boarded the plane'.
I actually didn't go abroad but went to another city.
'Different life path' refers to a life of deceiving parents and continuing to gamble.

title: The Painting
surface: I finally painted this picture for him, but I never imagined she would die just like that.
bottom: I am a famous painter. My best friend contracted a special illness, and only one specific medicine could treat it. However, the patent for this medicine was held by the boss of a pharmaceutical company. She had always been unscrupulous and had used this patent to blackmail many people. Sure enough, she knew I had always been aloof and insisted that I paint a picture eulogizing her before she would give me the medicine. For my friend, I still painted it. What I didn't know was that my friend was aware of all this. He didn't want me to grovel for him and also hated the boss's cruelty. During the days I was engrossed in painting, he was also engrossed in preparing his murder plan. When I opened the boss's office door with the painting, I saw the boss lying in a pool of blood. Next to her was my best friend holding a gun. He gave me a sad smile and pulled the trigger on himself.
tips: 'He' is my close friend, 'she' is the pharmaceutical company boss.
My friend is seriously ill and needs a specific medicine.
The specific medicine is monopolized and controlled by 'her'.
This painting is a bargaining chip to get life-saving medicine for my friend.
'She' was killed by my friend.
The friend chose to act because he didn't want to see me humiliated for him.
After killing 'her,' the friend also committed suicide.

title: Salvation
surface: I see her every day. If he hadn't stopped me, maybe I wouldn't be going to find her now.
bottom: Late at night, I lost control while drunk driving and crashed into a mother and daughter by the roadside. The mother died on the spot, and the daughter was seriously injured and unconscious. I saw the girl's pale little face in the hospital, filled with guilt. Finally, I decided to turn myself in to the police. But just as I was about to leave, my father pulled me back from behind, telling me to go home and rest first. The next day, my father used all his connections and money to cover up all the evidence. He even privately gave the victim's family a large sum of money to stop them from pursuing the matter. I thought I was free, but the self-condemnation grew stronger. Every night, I dreamed of the car accident, saw the mother's desperate eyes, and heard the girl's painful moans. In the end, I couldn't bear this pain and chose to end my own life.
tips: I am a hit-and-run driver who caused someone's death due to drunk driving.
'He' is my father, 'she' is the female victim of the car accident.
My father once stopped me from turning myself in to the police.
My father used his connections and money to cover up my crime.
'Seeing her every day' refers to hallucinations or dreams caused by guilt.
The true meaning of 'going to find her' is to seek spiritual relief through suicide.

title: Seeing
surface: Because they discovered I could see, I had to leave forever.
bottom: I was once a core member of a 'cult.' The founder was worshipped as a god. The cult demanded that any flaws in the founder be ignored, rationalized, and sanctified to maintain cohesion and authority. I was also one of the blind followers, deeply convinced. However, a chance opportunity led me to discover the founder's privately hoarded luxury goods and 'faith funds' donated by believers in his residence. I tried to communicate with my companions but was rejected and even accused. They believed my discovery was blasphemy and betrayal against the cult. To maintain the purity of the cult and the founder's image, I was collectively ostracized. At a gathering, the founder publicly denounced me, saying I was bewitched by demons and had strayed from the principles. Under the cold gaze of numerous believers, I was expelled from the cult. My former faith became a shadow. I saw clearly that the so-called faith was a scam, a farce where a cult exploited spiritual dependence. The cracks in the idol could no longer be mended.
tips: 'They' are members of a cult organization.
'Seeing' does not refer to eyesight, but to seeing through a scam.
The core of this organization is a deified founder.
I discovered evidence of the founder's hypocrisy and embezzlement.
Other members chose to ignore the truth and considered me a traitor.
'Leaving forever' means I was expelled from the organization for exposing the truth.

title: Going Home
surface: 'Go home, child,' accompanied by his voice, death came for me.
bottom: I am a freshwater turtle, caught and brought ashore. After several transfers, I ended up in the hands of a 'life-releaser.' However, his releasing was merely a performative self-gratification. He couldn't distinguish between freshwater turtles and sea turtles, thinking my home was the ocean. I died quickly after being thrown into the sea.
tips: My true identity is not human, but an animal.
I am a freshwater turtle.
'He' is an ignorant life-releaser.
'Going home' refers to me being released into the sea.
My cause of death was being unable to survive in seawater.
The life-releaser's good deed was based on incorrect understanding.

title: Wife
surface: I knocked on the door of my wife's parents' home with a gift, breaking out in a cold sweat.
bottom: I suspected my wife was cheating. After a big fight with her, I went out drinking. When I returned home, I saw a couple on the bed. Overcome with rage, I killed them. Then, thinking I might as well go all the way, I decided to wipe out my wife's family. However, I had actually gone to the wrong floor due to being drunk, and this household happened to have their door unlocked. When I knocked on my wife's parents' door, holding the bloody knife, I saw my wife who had returned to her parents' home. Only then did I realize I had killed the wrong people, and I broke out in a cold sweat.
tips: I had just committed murder.
I went to the wrong floor due to drunkenness and killed the wrong people.
'Gift' refers to the knife I used for the murder.
The deceased were strangers completely unrelated to me.
I thought I had killed my cheating wife.
My real purpose in coming to my in-laws' house was to continue the violence.
At the door, I saw my wife who should have been 'dead'.

title: The Box
surface: The Baron invited a couple to a banquet at his mansion. However, the husband suddenly told his wife he had urgent matters and couldn't attend. He personally went to the Baron's mansion to explain. The next day, his body was found in a box at the Baron's house.
bottom: The man was naturally suspicious and had suspected his wife of cheating multiple times, beating her, but not divorcing her due to lack of evidence. This time, the man again suspected his wife was having an affair with the Baron. He pretended he couldn't attend the banquet, and after personally visiting the Baron to explain, he hid in the Baron's house, intending to find evidence of his wife's infidelity. However, all of this was anticipated by the wife. To get rid of her suspicious husband and the Baron who was harassing her, she killed the man hidden in the box during the banquet and framed the Baron, killing two birds with one stone.
tips: The real murderer is the wife.
The husband hid in the box to catch them in the act of adultery.
The husband had a history of domestic violence.
The wife anticipated the husband's actions and made a plan.
The Baron was not the wife's lover, but a harasser.
The wife's goal was to 'kill two birds with one stone,' eliminating two people at once.

title: Fire
surface: A serious fire broke out downstairs from my home. The firefighters couldn't rescue me. I'm already in big trouble.
bottom: I had a criminal plan, and a crucial part of it was to create the illusion that I was at home at the time of the crime to provide a false alibi. However, while I was committing the crime, a fire broke out downstairs. Firefighters entered my home to rescue me but found I wasn't there. My plan failed.
tips: I am in the process of committing a crime.
When the fire broke out, I was not at home.
I needed a false alibi of 'being at home at the time'.
The firefighters' rescue operation unexpectedly ruined my alibi.
The truth of 'couldn't rescue me' is that the firefighters couldn't find me in my home.
'Big trouble' refers to my crime being about to be exposed.

title: Unemployment
surface: My brother's body remains unclaimed to this day, and I've also lost my job.
bottom: My brother and I are identical twins. We were bought by a gang when we were young. To protect me, my brother volunteered to be trained as a killer, and I was his assistant. Outsiders all thought we were one person, so when my brother went to kill someone, I could appear elsewhere to provide him with an alibi. But my brother died while he was out. To prevent things from being exposed, no one was willing to claim the body, and my career also ended.
tips: My brother and I are identical twins.
Our profession is a killer duo working for a criminal organization.
Outsiders always thought we were the same person.
My 'job' was to use our twin identity to create alibis for my brother.
Claiming the body would expose the secret that we are two people.
My brother's death made my job of providing alibis meaningless.

title: Promise
surface: Watching that mother kowtow endlessly, I called the newspaper office. Both of us chose to exchange reputation for life.
bottom: By chance, I saw a mother's plea for help. Her child urgently needed a large sum of money for medical treatment, but her plea went unnoticed. I decided to contact her and proposed an extreme condition: if she was willing to kowtow live on stream for an hour, I would cover her child's medical expenses. The mother agreed. After the live stream ended, I suddenly posted online, breaking my promise, and anonymously submitted the incident to the media, attaching a photo of her deceased husband who had once helped me. The media quickly reported it, and the mother's tragic situation aroused widespread sympathy, while I was accused of repaying kindness with ingratitude. Anger and sympathy turned into a flood of donations, and ultimately, her child was successfully cured. Although I was regarded as a liar by the public, I had fulfilled my repayment of kindness.
tips: 'Life' refers to the mother's critically ill child.
I deliberately broke the promise to pay the medical expenses.
My purpose was to create greater public opinion by playing the villain.
I had a past debt of gratitude to this mother's family; this act was to repay that kindness.
The mother's kowtowing was a pre-arranged 'performance'.
Public condemnation of me ultimately led to huge donations that saved the child.

title: Task
surface: I called my father. When we met, I was already in prison.
bottom: I am a con artist. That day, I called an old man, claiming to be his long-lost son. He was skeptical, but I was silver-tongued, mentioning various details of his past life, gradually making him lower his guard. We talked for a long time; he repeatedly reminded me of some trivial life matters. Finally, he sent the money as I wished. Unexpectedly, a message popped up right after: 'Child, I know you are not him. He passed away last month, but your voice sounds so much like his. Now, I don't want to live alone anymore. Leaving the money to you makes me feel a bit better.' I quickly called back, but no one answered. So I called the police. The police promptly sent the old man to the hospital and also arrested me.
tips: My true identity is a phone scammer.
'Father' is the target of my scam, not my biological father.
The old man had already seen through my scam but chose to cooperate.
After remitting the money, the old man planned to commit suicide to follow his deceased son.
I ultimately called the police to save the old man who was preparing to commit suicide.
I ended up in prison because I voluntarily called the police, thereby exposing my crime.

title: Destruction
surface: This time, my work will destroy everyone.
bottom: Back then, when I was just starting out, I didn't understand the unwritten rules and refused the critics' hints for bribes. As a result, my debut work received overwhelmingly negative reviews, and I myself was labeled notorious. Later, I learned the ways of the world, built good relationships with them through various means, and my works began to receive rave reviews. Today, I have become what people call an 'artist,' but I have never forgotten the initial humiliation. This time, I have meticulously prepared a shockingly bad film; every shot is infused with my fire of revenge. I can't wait to see how, when those critics who took my money praise this 'masterpiece' against their conscience, the discerning eyes of the audience will nail them to the pillar of shame. That day will be the day of their ruin and disgrace, and also the time for my sweet revenge.
tips: My profession is a director or artist.
'Destruction' is not physical but refers to the destruction of reputation.
The 'everyone' to be destroyed specifically refers to those corrupt critics.
This 'work' is a terrible film I deliberately produced.
The critics, having received benefits from me, have to praise it against their conscience.
My ultimate goal is revenge, to make these critics lose their reputation and be disgraced.

title: Employee
surface: I helped my employee complete the task, but he was not happy.
bottom: I hate my father. Living with him now is only for his inheritance. I really couldn't wait any longer, so I hired a killer to send him on his way. However, during an argument, I accidentally killed him. Fortunately, our body types are similar, so I could wear his clothes and pretend to be him to mislead others. What I didn't know was that when I disguised myself as my father and went out, the killer I hired also took action, but no one could pay him his 'salary' anymore.
tips: My 'employee' is a professional killer.
The 'task' is to kill my father.
I accidentally killed my father myself before the killer could act.
I disguised myself as my father to cover up the crime.
The killer saw me in disguise and mistook me for the target.
The killer was unhappy because he mistakenly killed his employer, which was me.

title: Radio
surface: Grandma Wang moved the old radio from the living room to the window, turned it on, smiling and sighing.
bottom: Grandma Wang's son passed away for some reason a few weeks ago. When he was alive, he was an avid radio enthusiast.
